name: Floating Publish Button
author: Do Ha Son

sections.description:
Floating Publish Button is perfect especially for editors who use the page and post editing interfaces more than regular administrators.

They’ll find this plugin extremely useful, since there won’t be any need to scroll up and hit Publish/Save every time they want to update the post, especially if it’s a really long post or a page with lots of metaboxes.

If this behavior is annoying for some users, it can easily be turned off from the user’s backend profile page.

  • Enable/Disable settings in Admin > Users > Your Profile > Publish/Update button
sections.installation:
1. Upload folder floating-publish-button to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.changelog:
1.0.6

  • Fix Logout covering issue

1.0.5

  • Update icon
  • Compatible with WP 4.0

1.0.4

  • Fix Media Popup issue
  • Move the floating box a bit lower

1.0.3

  • Fix drag & drop conflict issue

1.0.2

  • Update long and short description

1.0.1

  • Update settings in “Your Profile”
  • Update screenshot

short_description: A WordPress plugin that alters the position and behavior of the Publish button, making it stick to the top of the page when scrolling down the page
description:

If this behavior is annoying for some users, it can easily be turned off from the user’s backend profile page.

  • Enable/Disable settings in Admin > Users > Your Profile > Publish/Update button
